metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11730 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability exists where if a user opens a locally saved HTML file,this file can use file: URIs to access other files in the same directory orsub-directories if the names are known or guessed. The Fetch API can thenbe used to read the contents of any files stored in these directories andthey may uploaded to a server. It was demonstrated that in combination witha popular Android messaging app, if a malicious HTML attachment is sent toa user and they opened that attachment in Firefox, due to that app'spredictable pattern for locally-saved file names, it is possible to readattachments the victim received from other correspondents. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, and Thunderbird <60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
